metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3313 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent: Server: MyISAM). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.53 and earlier, 5.6.34 and earlier and 5.7.16 and earlier. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with logon to the infrastructure where MySQL Server executes to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS v3.0 Base Score 4.7 (Confidentiality impacts).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadbclient18 - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-5.5 - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-common - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-5.5 - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test-5.5 - 5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libmysqlclient18 - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libmysqld-pic - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-5.5 - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.5 - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.5 - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.5 - 5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.56-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mysql-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.54-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mysql-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
